subject: Re: JUnit 4.x and support for Java 1.4
msgSnippet: And ... I m an OOP enthusiast (often) encouraging further maturity in the use of inheritance within the Java community . To that end, when it makes sense, the
messageBody:
And ... I'm an OOP enthusiast (often) encouraging further maturity in
the use of inheritance within the Java "community".

To that end, when it makes sense, the preference is for inheritance
over declarative programming. And, it would be great to see JUnit 3x
continue to mature while maintaining its OOP stance.

_Marvin


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Mark Levison" <mlevison@...> wrote:
>
> On 9/15/06, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:

I don't want an upgraded 3.8.1.

I'm looking to switch to JUnit 4 but get it running under Java 1.4.

In general I also prefer the declarative approach of JUnit 4 to the
inheritance based approach of 3.8.1.

> Thanks in advance.
> Mark
